extraLines: While wielded, this mythical weapon is a proverbial banner, rallying the troops with its glorious visage, shimmering across the battlefield. Not
only does it enhance the wielder's ability to lead, it will also allow him to properly 'motivate' the followers when all methods of diplomacy fail.
On the downside, anyone wielding this weapon will become convinced of their own invincibility at the expense of self-defense, and healthy common sense,
as well being afflicted with an overpowering need for posturing that would be more fitting on some parade rather than in battle. Then again, this is the
Glorious Crowbar.
It should also be noted that it would be ridiculously easy to open a manhole with this particular crowbar since it is, after all, THE Crowbar.

name: A tarnished silver ring with nine gemstones

stats.data: This item loses its magical powers somewhat slower than average.

extraLines: The gemstones of this ring contain a volatile enchantment that is empowered by the absorbance of hostile magics. This energy can then be 'released' to
provide a corresponding protection against the ravages of the world.
The power of the protection is relative to the amount of magic that has been absorbed since the last release.
Once the energy has been released, the resulting protection remains in place until it has been completely expelled by subsequent assaults. During this time
further attempts of release are impossible.

extraLines: The prismatic belt allows the wearer to 'allocate' stat points.
The wearer can use 'allocate <stat> <#> to shift the stat bonuses of the belt around.  If the wearer wishes to reset the
maximum stats of the belt, he can grant negative stats.  The belt never grants more than 20 in any given stat except strength,
which has a much lower statmax.   The wearer can 'belt_display' to show how many stats the belt is currently granting.

As a god-blessed weapon this bow can be used only by those who have accepted
Xellios as their deity.
If the archer is seen worthy the bow will manifest a string, and its own arrows but their power is always subjective to the piety and the skill of
the archer. Each manifested arrow will drain a very small amount of magical energy from the archer.

extraLines: This bow draws its power from the sun, manifesting arrows of pure light as long as it is allowed to periodically recharge under the rays of the sun. While it

Due to the nature of its arrows, it is more lethal against the undead and those allergic to sunlight.
